title: Mastoidectomy VR Simulation Training: Self-Regulated Learning Program Based on Deliberate Practice

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: Learners requiring improved time management and self-regulation skills through smartphone-based VR simulation tools

learning_goals: In a VR environment, learners can accurately identify external anatomical boundaries during a mastoidectomy and prevent drilling errors with over 80% accuracy.
Learners can reduce the damage rate to critical structures in the temporal bone (e.g., semicircular canals, stapes, facial nerve) by 30% after five training sessions.
Learners can shorten goal-achievement time by 20% while relying on simulation tutor functions at or below 50%.
Learners can independently determine the endpoint of surgery and achieve over 70% alignment between self-assessment and expert evaluation in the final assessment.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
